content.description:
Researchers interested in examining the effect of various treatments on reducing symptoms of cases of persistent depressive disorder compared treatment method outcomes for three groups. They measured the reduction in symptoms for three groups of 10 individuals with persistent depressive disorder over the course of 16 weeks. The results depicted in the graph indicate that no significant differences were found among the three groups.

Impact of Treatments on Persistent Depressive Disorder Symptoms
content.question: What research design was most likely used in the study?

choices.label: Experimental design with a control group and random assignment
Cross-sectional design comparing different groups at a single point in time
Longitudinal design following participants over an extended period
Descriptive research using the method of naturalistic observation

content.answer: Cross-sectional design comparing different groups at a single point in time

skill.text: 2.A: Determine the type of research design(s) used in a given study.
